overview: John Hunt is a serially successful entrepreneur and venture investor, now investing through his holding company Archimedia. He has created or co-created companies across diverse sectors and geographies. He co-founded UK espresso bar chain Seattle Coffee Company which was acquired by Starbucks as their European launch platform in 1998. He founded web agency Syzygy which in turn acquired agencies from WPP in Paris and Frankfurt before going public at â‚¬200 million in Germany in 1999. He founded e-commerce software company Obongo in Silicon Valley which was acquired by AOL Time Warner in 2001 to become their Quick Checkout platform. He co-created the top rated resort in the Caribbean - Amanyara in Turks & Caicos Islands - which opened in 2006. He created the worlds first global fine wine brand, Oriel, which launched US retail distribution in 2007. He was also a founder investor in UK deli / cafe chain Carluccio’s which went public in 2005 and is currently a founding investor in online ventures Betfair and Made.com.

funding_round.source_description: Made.com raises Â£2.5m to assault designer furniture industry
